Description: Brass lamp: elongated, deep rounded body, tapering to a slightly flaring nozzle-end, with an oval flat area round the circular wick-hole; small knobs on each side of the wick-hole area. Raised rim round the filling-hole, with a hinge-piece at the rear holding a circular lamp-lid with a small knob-handle. Ring-handle at the rear, surmounted by a cross; an extension of the ring-handle runs as a tongue up the rear of the crucifix. High, slightly flaring base, hollow within, and with a circular socket for the spike of a lamp-stand. The sleeve of the socket, within the oil chamber, is lost. Surface colouration: dull, even green.
Curator's comments: Close: Selesnow, W., 1988. ‘Liebieghaus-Museum, Frankfurt, Lampen aus Ton und Bronze’. Melsungen : Gutenberg, 442, from Egypt; Eton College, Myers Collection, No. 1520, from Egypt; Strzygowski, J., 1904. ‘Catalogue général des antiquités égyptiennes du Musée du Caire’. Vienna : A. Holzhausen, 9138, in Cairo. Near: ibid. 9146, in Cairo.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q3823EA)
Xanthopoulou 2010 / Les lampes en bronze à l’époque paléochrétienne (LA 3.077)
